intro: Galium dacicum, commonly known as the Dacian bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are white or pale green, clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, and bloom in early summer. Galium dacicum is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
